results_summary: Upregulating LHPP expression via miRNA-363-5p inhibition led to significant tumor inhibition (88.2%) in HCC xenografts by triggering nonferrous ferroptosis and enhancing immunogenicity, with no notable hematologic toxicity or organ damage.
population_specificity: Nude mice bearing Bel-7402 tumor xenografts (HCC model).
effective_dosage: GOA/miR-363-5pi nanoparticles at a molar feed ratio of 250:1 (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the source of histidine and the role of the gut microbiota in the production of Imidazole Propionate (ImP) and its effects on insulin signaling in mice and humans.
results_summary: Dietary histidine was metabolized to ImP, with gut microbiota suppression reducing ImP levels in mice. In humans, oral histidine supplementation increased circulating ImP levels, while antibiotic treatment unexpectedly increased ImP levels, linked to bacterial genera like Lactobacilli.
population_specificity: Mice on a high-fat diet and humans (healthy and T2D subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of a histidine-containing peptide-functionalized quantum dot (CdSe/ZnS-PH) as an intracellular pH probe to study the mechanism of action of cisplatin and volasertib in melanoma cells.
results_summary: The study found that histidine-functionalized quantum dots effectively monitored intracellular pH changes, revealing faster acidification with cisplatin compared to volasertib. Early acidification correlated with accelerated apoptosis in cisplatin-treated cells, while both drugs showed similar inhibitory effects after prolonged incubation.
population_specificity: SK-Mel-2 melanoma cells (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the long-term clearance kinetics of HRP2 (a histidine-rich protein) in peripheral blood after treatment of uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum malaria.
results_summary: The study found that HRP2 clearance is prolonged, with a terminal half-life of 9 days post-parasite clearance, remaining detectable for up to 28 days after successful treatment, which impacts RDT-based malaria diagnosis.
population_specificity: Patients with uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum mono-infection in Gabon.
effective_dosage: 3-day course of artesunate/amodiaquine (specific dosages not mentioned).

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the performance of the ParaHIT RDT and assess the proportion of pfhrp2/3 gene-deleted P. falciparum parasites in Togo.
results_summary: The ParaHIT RDT showed high sensitivity (96.4% vs microscopy, 97.9% vs PCR) and specificity (85.7% vs microscopy, 90.7% vs PCR). No pfhrp2 or pfhrp3 gene deletions were detected in the sequenced samples.
population_specificity: Children aged 6-59 months in Togo.
study_duration: Cross-sectional study conducted from September 2021 to January 2022.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how electroacupuncture (EA) treatment affects Parkinson's disease (PD) via METTL9-mediated histidine methylation of NF-κB RELA, inhibiting NLRP3 transcription.
results_summary: EA treatment improved motor dysfunction in PD mice by restoring neuron loss, reducing pro-inflammatory cytokines, and suppressing neuronal pyroptosis. METTL9 promoted histidine methylation of NF-κB RELA, inhibiting NLRP3 transcription, but METTL9 deficiency dampened these effects.
population_specificity: MPTP-induced Parkinson's disease mice model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of histidine-rich glycoprotein (HRG) in tPA-related hemorrhagic transformation (HT) and its potential protective effects in acute ischemic stroke (AIS).
results_summary: The study found that HRG levels increased after tPA infusion but not in patients who developed HT. HRG reduced neutrophil NETosis, inflammation, and blood-brain barrier migration induced by tPA, and its administration in a murine model ameliorated HT by inhibiting neutrophil infiltration and pro-inflammatory pathways.
population_specificity: Patients with acute ischemic stroke (AIS) (discovery cohort n=10, validation cohort n=157) and a photothrombotic murine AIS model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary histidine supplementation improves glycemic control in individuals with type 2 diabetes (T2D) and healthy controls, and to explore the role of gut microbiota and MAIT cells in this process.
results_summary: Histidine supplementation improved markers of glycemic control, including postprandial glucose levels, and increased MAIT cell proportions. These effects were linked to changes in gut microbial pathways (e.g., riboflavin biosynthesis) and epigenetic modifications in the amino acid transporter SLC7A5.
population_specificity: Participants with type 2 diabetes (T2D) and healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether histidine-functionalized chitosan nanoformulation (C-H NF) enhances physico-biochemical properties and improves growth and physiological processes in Tomato plants.
results_summary: C-H NF demonstrated improved nanoparticle properties (size, PDI, zeta potential, etc.) and positively impacted Tomato plant growth, antioxidant enzyme activity, ROS content, chlorophyll, and nitrogen levels.
population_specificity: Tomato seedlings and potted plants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between Histidine-rich glycoprotein (HRG) concentrations and critical conditions like septic shock, DIC, and ARDS in critically ill sepsis patients.
results_summary: Serum HRG levels were significantly reduced in patients with septic shock and DIC but not ARDS. Lower HRG levels, particularly on days 3, 5, and 7, were associated with higher mortality, while stable levels correlated with survival. A cutoff of 25.5 μg/mL on day 5 predicted survival with moderate sensitivity and specificity.
population_specificity: 53 critically ill patients admitted to the ICU at Kyushu University Hospital.
study_duration: Blood samples were collected on days 1, 3, 5, and 7 post-ICU admission.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the mechanism of action of compound A16B1, a synthetic hydrazone inhibitor, against the Salmonella PhoP/PhoQ system, essential for virulence.
results_summary: A16B1 selectively inhibited the Salmonella PhoP/PhoQ system, demonstrated synergy with colistin, reduced intramacrophage proliferation of Salmonella, and enhanced survival in an in vivo infection model.
population_specificity: Salmonella-infected Galleria mellonella larvae and in vitro systems.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of ultrasound-assisted L-histidine on the physicochemical properties and conformation of soybean protein isolate (SPI), focusing on structural and functional changes.
results_summary: Ultrasound-assisted L-His treatment reduced SPI particle size, increased solubility, and improved emulsification and antioxidant properties by altering protein conformation and forming a complex with SPI. At 0.3% w/w L-His, the nanocomplex showed optimal particle size, ζ-potential, and emulsification stability.
population_specificity: Soybean protein isolate (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role and localization of TcsC, a fungal-specific histidine kinase in Aspergillus fumigatus, in response to hyperosmotic stress and antifungal agents.
results_summary: The study found that TcsC, initially thought to be cytoplasmic, localizes to the nucleus and translocates to the cytoplasm upon activation by hyperosmotic stress or the antifungal fludioxonil. The N-terminal 208 amino acids of TcsC are crucial for nuclear localization and stress response, but nuclear targeting is not required for TcsC-mediated stress adaptation.
population_specificity: Aspergillus fumigatus (fungal pathogen)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel affinity separation strategy using polyhistidine-tag (His6-Tag) to improve the elution and identification of arsenic binding proteins in cells.
results_summary: The study successfully identified 41 arsenic binding proteins using the new method, which involved magnetic beads modified with His6-Tag and SA, enabling efficient capture and gentle digestion for precise identification. The method also allowed bead regeneration for reuse.
population_specificity: HepG2 cells (a human liver cancer cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether L-histidine could mitigate the deleterious effects of elevated non-esterified fatty acids (NEFAs) on Bovine Mammary Epithelial Cells (BMECs), particularly focusing on inflammation and cell proliferation.
results_summary: L-histidine treatment counteracted NEFA-induced inflammation in BMECs by inhibiting Gab2 expression, normalized cell proliferation, and significantly reduced IL-6 and IL-8 levels. RNA sequencing revealed differential gene expression linked to proliferation and immunity pathways.
population_specificity: Bovine Mammary Epithelial Cells (BMECs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the interaction between L-histidine and NEFA metabolism in bovine mammary epithelial cells (BMECs) and explore L-histidine's potential mitigating effects on NEFA-induced metabolic disruptions.
results_summary: The study found that L-histidine treatment altered metabolite profiles in BMECs, particularly affecting lipid biosynthesis pathways, with 1-Linoleoylglycerophosphocholine identified as a potential key mediator. These changes suggest L-histidine may counteract some metabolic disruptions caused by elevated NEFA levels.
population_specificity: Bovine mammary epithelial cells (BMECs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate porous polymer microspheres (SPSDVB-PAA-Cu) for the selective adsorption and separation of histidine-rich proteins from complex biosamples like human blood and plasma.
results_summary: The SPSDVB-PAA-Cu microspheres effectively adsorbed histidine-rich proteins (e.g., hemoglobin and human serum albumin) with high capacity and selectively depleted abundant proteins (81.6% to 30.7%) while enriching low-abundance proteins (18.4% to 69.3%) in human plasma.
population_specificity: Human whole blood and plasma samples.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the resistance mechanism of fungicides (fludioxonil and iprodione) in Botrytis cinerea, focusing on mutations in the Bos1 protein.
results_summary: Mutations (F127S, I365S/N, F127S + I365N, I376M) in the Bos1 protein reduced binding energy between the drugs and BcBos1, leading to resistance. Resistant strains showed decreased biological fitness (growth rate, sporulation, pathogenicity) and altered glycerol content compared to sensitive strains.
population_specificity: Botrytis cinerea fungal strains

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Histidine-Tryptophan-Ketoglutarate (HTK) solution is linked to an increased incidence of postoperative acute kidney injury (AKI) compared to del Nido cardioplegia in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass surgery (CABG).
results_summary: The study found a significantly higher incidence of AKI in the HTK group compared to the del Nido group, though the need for renal replacement therapy (RRT) did not differ significantly. HTK was identified as a significant risk factor for AKI, and serum sodium and calcium levels decreased following HTK infusion.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing coronary artery bypass surgery (CABG).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify metabolic and endothelial factors, including amino acids like Histidine, that predict 30-day survival in sepsis patients.
results_summary: The study found that amino acids, including Histidine, were among the features important for predicting sepsis survival, with metabolic dysregulation in endothelial cells potentially contributing to sepsis outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients admitted to an intensive care unit for sepsis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether histidine supplementation could counteract 6-mercaptopurine (6-MP) resistance in pediatric B-cell lineage acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL).
results_summary: Histidine supplementation significantly improved sensitivity to 6-MP in resistant B-ALL, partly through increased tetrahydrofolate consumption. The study also identified SIRT5-mediated desuccinylation as a critical factor for histidine's synergistic effect in overcoming 6-MP resistance.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with B-cell lineage acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effect of D-histidine on Pseudomonas aeruginosa biofilms, including its impact on virulence, motility, biofilm formation, and antibiotic susceptibility.
results_summary: D-histidine downregulated virulence and quorum sensing genes, reduced bacterial motility, inhibited biofilm formation, and disassembled mature biofilms. It also enhanced the susceptibility of Pseudomonas aeruginosa to amikacin, showing a synergistic effect.
population_specificity: Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of histidine residues in the dengue virus envelope protein during viral maturation and release.
results_summary: Mutations of specific histidine residues (H144A, H244A, H261A, H282A) disrupted viral-like particle formation, suggesting their critical role in maturation at acidic pH. Acidotropic amine treatment reversed these defects, indicating histidine's involvement in pH-dependent conformational changes.
population_specificity: In vitro study using viral-like particle (VLP) system.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic performance of HRP2-based malaria rapid diagnostic tests (mRDTs) and microscopy compared to species-specific qPCR, and to assess the prevalence of pfhrp2/pfhrp3 gene deletions in P. falciparum.
results_summary: The study found that mRDTs had higher sensitivity (95%) and specificity (68%) compared to microscopy (77% and 44%, respectively) for detecting P. falciparum. Only one pfhrp2/pfhrp3 gene deletion was detected among 165 P. falciparum-positive samples.
population_specificity: 207 symptomatic individuals (children and adults) at a hospital in Nnewi, Nigeria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether anserine (a histidine-containing dipeptide) could suppress the development of heart failure by inhibiting p300-HAT activity.
results_summary: Anserine significantly suppressed phenylephrine-induced cardiomyocyte hypertrophy and histone H3K9 acetylation in vitro, and in mice, it prevented TAC-induced systolic dysfunction and histone H3K9 acetylation. The study suggests anserine may be a potential therapeutic agent for heart failure.
population_specificity: Primary cardiomyocytes (in vitro) and 8-week-old male C57BL/6J mice (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of exogenous l-histidine on pyruvate kinase phosphorylation and activity in early postmortem muscle under low NaCl conditions.
results_summary: The study found that 0.06% l-histidine caused PK dephosphorylation, increased PK activity, and altered PK secondary structure, suggesting potential for improving meat quality under low NaCl conditions.
population_specificity: Early postmortem muscle (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether histidine biosynthesis by Faecalibaculum rodentium (F. rodentium) plays a role in protecting against colitis in mouse models.
results_summary: The study found that EN-induced F. rodentium accumulation protected against colitis via histidine biosynthesis, with significant histidine enrichment observed in the F. rodentium culture supernatant. Engineered Escherichia coli Nissle 1917 (EcN-hisG) also demonstrated protective effects against colitis.
population_specificity: Mouse models (DSS-induced colitis and Il10-/- spontaneous colitis) and CD patient metagenome datasets.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether histidine treatment could mitigate cognitive impairment and neuronal damage caused by diabetes mellitus combined with recurrent hypoglycemia.
results_summary: The study found that histidine treatment attenuated cognitive impairment and rescued neuronal and synaptic damage in the hippocampus, likely due to improved mitochondrial function.
population_specificity: Mice exposed to diabetes mellitus and recurrent hypoglycemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify natural compounds that inhibit transmembrane histidine kinase in bacteria, potentially serving as novel antibacterial treatments for mastitis.
results_summary: The study identified two natural compounds (ZINC000085569031 and ZINC000257435291) and Tetracycline as strong inhibitors of transmembrane histidine kinase, suggesting their potential for developing antibacterial veterinary medicine.
population_specificity: Streptococcus agalactiae (bacteria causing mastitis)
study_duration: Molecular dynamics simulations were conducted for 100 ns.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of L-histidine-assisted ultrasound on the physicochemical characteristics and conformation of myofibrillar protein under reduced-salt conditions and elucidate the binding mechanism between L-histidine and the protein.
results_summary: L-histidine formed a complex with myofibrillar protein, altering its microenvironment and improving solubility, particle size, and structural uniformity. Molecular docking and simulations identified hydrophobic interactions and hydrogen bonds as key binding forces, with specific residues involved in the interaction.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on myofibrillar protein)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to create and characterize a recombinant 6×His-tagged carboxyl esterase (EstB) derived from Geobacillus sp. for potential industrial applications.
results_summary: The recombinant EstB was successfully expressed, purified, and shown to be highly active at pH 8.0 and stable at high temperatures (65°C), retaining 70% activity after 1 hour at 60°C. The enzyme demonstrated favorable kinetic parameters, suggesting its suitability for industrial use.
population_specificity: Escherichia coli (E. coli) as an expression host; no human or animal subjects were involved.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (enzyme activity measured as 51.76 U/mg protein).
study_duration: Expression scaled up to 3.5 hours in a 7-L bioreactor.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the utility of histidine-containing dipeptide (HCD) supplementation as a cognitive stabilizer by analyzing its effects on cognitive performance in humans through a systematic review and meta-analysis of RCTs.
results_summary: HCD supplementation significantly improved performance on the Wechsler Memory Scale-2 Delayed recall but showed no significant effects on other cognitive tests like the Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-Cognitive, Mini-Mental State Examination, or Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale subtests. The positive effect on delayed recall persisted in subgroup analyses of patients without mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and those aged above 65.
population_specificity: Humans, including subgroups without mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and older adults (average age above 65).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a high-throughput fluorimetric assay for detecting histidine in human urine using a smartphone-based method.
results_summary: The assay demonstrated linearity up to 100 μM histidine with an LLOQ of 10 μM, showing minimal interference from glutathione and histamine. Results from human urine samples (280–1540 μM histidine) aligned well with HPLC validation.
population_specificity: Human urine samples (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of histidine phosphorylation (pHis) and the loss of the histidine phosphatase LHPP in intestinal inflammation, particularly in colitis.
results_summary: The study found that intestinal inflammation correlates with LHPP loss in DSS-treated mice and IBD patients, with increased pHis observed in intestinal epithelial cells. However, LHPP ablation alone did not increase pHis or promote inflammation, suggesting pHis plays a role in colitis but LHPP loss is insufficient to cause it.
population_specificity: DSS-treated mice and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of supplemental histidine (His) on lactational performance, plasma His concentration, and efficiency of digestible His utilization in dairy cows.
results_summary: His supplementation increased plasma His concentration, dry matter intake (DMI), milk yield (MY), milk true protein concentration (MTP), and milk true protein yield (MTPY), with greater effects observed in metabolizable protein-deficient diets. Nonlinear responses to increasing His supply were noted, and infused His showed greater efficacy than rumen-protected His.
population_specificity: Dairy cows

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether poly(l-histidine) surface coatings on ceria nanocages could enhance corneal penetration and enable pH-responsive drug release for treating ocular chemical burns.
results_summary: The study found that poly(l-histidine) coatings significantly improved corneal penetration (24-fold enhancement) and enabled smart drug release in response to pH changes, leading to reduced corneal wound areas, attenuated abnormal blood vessels, and restored transparency in an alkali burn model.
population_specificity: Rat model of alkali burn

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether histidine-doped FeS2 nanozymes (FeSN) could effectively remove oral biofilms and treat periodontitis.
results_summary: FeSN demonstrated high peroxidase-like activity, robust antibacterial effects against Fusobacterium nucleatum, and significant reduction in biofilm formation, inflammation, and alveolar bone loss in a rat model of periodontitis. It also showed excellent biocompatibility and low cytotoxicity.
population_specificity: Rat model of periodontitis (specific human population not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop histidine-modified peptides for intracellular delivery of therapeutic proteins, focusing on endosomal escape and targeted cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that histidine-substituted peptides (e.g., hsLMWP) enabled efficient endosomal escape and cytosolic delivery of protein cargoes, showing strong anti-tumor efficacy in xenograft mice without apparent side effects. The modular design allowed flexible applications for various antibody/cargo combinations.
population_specificity: Multiple cancer cell types and xenograft mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a pH-responsive hexa-histidine metal assembly (HmA) for glucose-mediated insulin delivery in diabetic mice.
results_summary: HmA@GCI effectively reduced blood glucose levels to normal within half an hour and maintained this effect for over 5 days with a single injection, extending to nearly 24 days with four injections. No hypoglycemia or toxicity was observed during the study.
population_specificity: Diabetic mice
effective_dosage: Single subcutaneous injection (specific dosage not detailed)
study_duration: Up to 24 days with four injections

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a multi-program responsive drug carrier (VCH) incorporating histidine for improved cancer drug delivery, focusing on pH sensitivity, targeting, and lysosomal escape.
results_summary: The VCH nanocarrier demonstrated high drug loading (21.0%) and encapsulation efficiency (66.6%), effective tumor inhibition (56.27%), and reduced tumor volume/weight (TIR 45.81%) without damaging normal organs. The carrier showed pH sensitivity, sustained drug release, and enhanced solubility and targeting.
population_specificity: HepG2 cancer cells (in vitro) and tumor models (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if histidine (His) uptake/metabolism is dysregulated in pancreatic cancer (PC) and whether combining His with gemcitabine (Gem) enhances Gem's anticancer effects.
results_summary: His levels were low in PC patients and mice; His + Gem showed potent cytotoxic effects in PC cells, increased oxidative stress, depleted amino acids and glutathione, and reduced tumor mass while improving survival in mice.
population_specificity: Human subjects and genetically engineered mice with pancreatic tumors.
interactions: Gemcitabine (enhanced anticancer effect when combined with His)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the structural and conformational effects of histidine tautomeric states (δ and ε) on transthyretin (TTR) misfolding and amyloidosis.
results_summary: The study found that β-sheet formation was more frequent in δδ and εδ tautomeric isomers of TTR fragments, suggesting a link between these configurations and structural stability/toxicity. Histidines 31 and 56 played roles in both regular and nonregular secondary structures within toxic TTR isomers, highlighting potential targets for amyloidosis treatment.
population_specificity: In silico (computational) study using molecular dynamics simulations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether histidine-rich glycoprotein (HRG) depletion promotes catheter thrombosis and if HRG supplementation could prevent it.
results_summary: HRG knockdown shortened activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) and significantly reduced catheter occlusion time, while FXII knockdown prolonged aPTT and occlusion time, suggesting HRG modulates thrombosis.
population_specificity: Rabbits

study_goal: To evaluate the potential of antisense oligonucleotide (ASON) therapy for treating autosomal dominant retinitis pigmentosa (adRP) caused by the P23H mutation in the rhodopsin gene.
results_summary: ASON therapy demonstrated a dose-dependent and selective reduction of P23H mutant rhodopsin mRNA in animal models and is currently in a phase 1/2 clinical trial for humans. The therapy shows promise as a nonviral, reversible treatment delivered via intravitreal injection.
population_specificity: Animal models and human clinical trial participants (phase 1/2) with adRP caused by the P23H mutation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of combining photodynamic therapy (PDT) with chemotherapy using gold(I) complexes bound to N-heterocyclic carbenes (NHC) based on histidine and histamine.
results_summary: The study found that the compounds exhibited high photoinduced activity, with gold(I) complexes showing maximum specific activity at longer incubation times. The histamine-based Au(I) complex enhanced antitumor activity and increased remission rates after photodynamic treatment.
population_specificity: In vitro and in vivo models (specific human or animal details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically characterize the reactivity of histidine residues in the human proteome and identify hyper-reactive sites for potential therapeutic targeting.
results_summary: The study quantified over 8,200 histidine residues, identifying 317 hyper-reactive sites, and observed that hyper-reactive residues were less likely to be phosphorylation sites. The findings suggest histidine residues could serve as bindable sites for disrupting protein activities and that acrolein derivatives may be useful in covalent inhibitor development.
population_specificity: Human proteome (in vitro analysis)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antimicrobial and antibiofilm activity of heraclenol, a compound that inhibits histidine biosynthesis, against uropathogenic Escherichia coli (UPEC).
results_summary: Heraclenol demonstrated significant antimicrobial and antibiofilm effects, reducing bacterial load by ≥4 logs in a murine catheter UTI model and decreasing biofilm formation by 70%. However, its high MIC value (1024 µg/mL) suggests limited clinical applicability without further modifications.
population_specificity: Murine (mouse) model of catheter-associated urinary tract infection (UTI).
effective_dosage: Not specified (only MIC value of 1024 µg/mL mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how electric fields (EFs) influence the conformational dynamics of β-Amyloid40 (Aβ40) under histidine tautomerism, potentially impacting protein misfolding in neurodegeneration.
results_summary: The study found that EFs, particularly at 0.5 V/nm, reduced β-sheet content (a toxic agent) and intra-protein hydrogen bonds in Aβ40, while also decreasing alpha-helical structures that could convert to β-sheets. These changes suggest EF application may destabilize harmful peptide structures.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on Aβ40 peptides under histidine tautomerism).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (EF strength of 0.5 V/nm was the primary intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how histidine influences ROS reduction and improves maize root tolerance to salt stress.
results_summary: Histidine reduced oxidative stress markers (superoxide anion radicals, hydrogen peroxide, malondialdehyde) and nitrogen content while increasing antioxidant enzyme activities and enriching DEGs involved in hormone signaling, glycolysis, and nitrogen metabolism pathways.
population_specificity: Maize roots under salt stress (100 mM NaCl).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic performance of histidine-rich protein-2 (PfHRP2)-based rapid diagnostic tests (RDTs) for malaria in Burkina Faso.
results_summary: The study found that HRP2-based RDTs had high sensitivity (98.5%) but low specificity (40.5%), leading to over-prescription of antimalarials. Expert microscopy revealed that 21.7% of cases received inappropriate antimalarial treatment.
population_specificity: Febrile children under 5 years with an axillary temperature ≥37.5 °C in the health district of Nanoro, Burkina Faso.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the frequency of pfhrp2 and pfhrp3 gene deletions in Plasmodium falciparum strains in Central and West Africa to evaluate the risk of false-negative rapid diagnostic test (RDT) results.
results_summary: The study found low prevalences of pfhrp2 and pfhrp3 single deletions (0-1%) and double deletions (1.6% in Nigeria only), suggesting minimal risk of false-negative RDT results in the studied regions. Continuous monitoring was recommended due to potential rapid changes in deletion frequencies.
population_specificity: Samples from Gabon (N=534), Republic of Congo (N=917), Nigeria (N=466), and Benin (N=120).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of nested PCR, light microscopy, and PfHRP2 RDT in detecting falciparum malaria in Akure, Nigeria.
results_summary: The study found that PfHRP2 RDT and microscopy were highly sensitive and specific for falciparum malaria diagnosis, with near-perfect agreement with nested PCR. However, RDT had slightly higher false negativity compared to microscopy.
population_specificity: 601 febrile volunteer participants in Akure, Nigeria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how Poly (L-histidine) (PLH) affects the adsorption and desorption behavior of gemcitabine (GMC) on graphene nanosheets (GNS) for targeted drug delivery in cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that PLH increased drug efficiency and targeting when covalently attached to GNS, with higher free energy in acidic conditions (-281.26 kJ/mol) compared to neutral conditions (-346.24 kJ/mol), suggesting improved drug desorption in lower pH environments.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro molecular dynamics simulation)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the immunomodulatory effects of histidine dipeptides (HD) and chicken broth hydrolysate (CBH) in preventing cyclophosphamide-induced immunosuppression in mice.
results_summary: CBH and HD reduced immune organ atrophy, stimulated lymphocyte proliferation, improved immune markers (WBC, IgM, IgG, IgA), and modulated cytokine production (IL-2, IFN-γ, IL-10) and signaling pathways (NO/cGMP-cAMP/PKA). The effects of CBH were comparable to purified HD.
population_specificity: Immunosuppressed mice induced by cyclophosphamide.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of histidine-rich glycoprotein (HRG) in sepsis and inflammatory diseases by examining its mechanisms of action, including inhibition of DAMPs/PAMPs.
results_summary: HRG demonstrated marked therapeutic effects in sepsis by neutralizing HMGB1, heme, and LPS toxicity, inhibiting immune thrombus formation, ROS production, and HMGB1 translocation. These actions suggest broad therapeutic applications for inflammatory diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely preclinical or animal models, based on mechanisms described).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory effects of ovothiol (ovo), its precursor 5-thiohistidine (5-thio), and ergothioneine (erg) in human skin cells and tissues.
results_summary: Ovo, 5-thio, and erg showed protective effects against TNF-α-induced inflammation in HaCaT cells and ex vivo human skin tissues, downregulating inflammatory genes (IL-8, TNF-α, COX-2) and reducing cytokine production (IL-6, IL-8, TNF-α). Their effects were stronger than dexamethasone in some cases.
population_specificity: Human keratinocytes (HaCaT cell line) and ex vivo human skin biopsies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of histidine supplementation on HARS variants associated with Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 2W (CMT2W) and Usher syndrome type IIIB, focusing on mistranslation, protein aggregation, and cellular viability.
results_summary: Histidine supplementation had mixed effects: it rescued insoluble protein accumulation in V155G and S356N mutants but caused toxicity (protein aggregation and reduced viability) in V133F and Y330C mutants. Mistranslation of histidine to glutamine and threonine occurred in some mutants, impacting cellular health.
population_specificity: Yeast model with human HARS variants (V133F, V155G, Y330C, S356N, Y454S).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the presence of pfhrp2/3 gene-deleted P. falciparum parasites in a healthcare setting to assess the reliability of histidine-rich protein 2 (PFHRP2)-based rapid diagnostic tests (RDTs) for malaria detection.
results_summary: The study found molecular evidence of pfhrp2 and pfhrp3 gene deletions in P. falciparum parasites, leading to false-negative RDT results despite microscopic confirmation of infection. These deletions varied in flanking gene patterns, suggesting potential limitations of PFHRP2-based RDTs in certain regions.
population_specificity: Patients with microscopically confirmed P. falciparum infections in a tertiary care center in South India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between pretreatment nutritional and inflammatory status, including serum histidine levels, and clinical outcomes in patients with locally advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
results_summary: The study found that cancer patients had lower serum histidine levels compared to healthy controls, and pretreatment histidine levels were associated with mortality rates. Lower histidine levels correlated with poorer survival outcomes in patients with high inflammation and malnutrition.
population_specificity: 50 patients with locally advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (LAHNSCC) and ECOG performance status ≤ 2, along with 43 healthy participants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of dietary histidine in weight regulation, metabolic health, and body composition in male mice and its association with human body mass index.
results_summary: Reducing dietary histidine by 67% decreased weight gain in young male mice, reversed obesity and hepatic steatosis in obese mice, and improved insulin sensitivity without altering glucose metabolism. Dietary histidine levels were positively associated with body mass index in humans.
population_specificity: Male C57BL/6J mice (young, lean and diet-induced obese) and humans (for BMI association).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antitumor efficacy of histidine decarboxylase inhibitors (α-MHD and EGCG) alone and combined with carboplatin in preclinical models of Leydig cell tumors (LCT).
results_summary: α-MHD monotherapy reduced tumor growth and angiogenesis in a syngeneic model, while the combination of EGCG plus carboplatin was most effective in xenografts, leading to tumor growth arrest and undetectable plasmatic estradiol levels without altering testicular or body weights.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (fetal to pubertal) with Leydig cell tumors and preclinical mouse models (MA-10 and R2C Leydig tumor cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify potential therapeutic biomarkers, including Histidine kinase EvgS, to combat multi-drug resistant Shigella flexneri by analyzing gene interaction networks and structural dynamics.
results_summary: The study identified Histidine kinase EvgS as a hub protein linked to antimicrobial resistance and virulence mechanisms, validated through differential gene expression and structural analysis. Molecular dynamics simulations confirmed the C-terminal extracellular domain of EvgS as a potential drug-binding site.
population_specificity: Multi-drug resistant Shigella flexneri 2a (bacterial strain)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of poly(l-histidine) (PLH) as a pH-responsive nanovehicle for targeted cancer drug delivery in the acidic tumor microenvironment.
results_summary: The study found that PLH-based nanovehicles exhibit pH-dependent hydrophobic-to-hydrophilic transitions in acidic conditions, enabling targeted drug release in tumors. These nanovehicles showed promise for enhancing therapeutic specificity and reducing toxicity compared to conventional carriers.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on in vitro or preclinical applications).
